historical.hint: Do not activate without a frank and open discussion with everyone at the table about including these elements. See the journal entry for Dark Caribbean Wave Crawl: Historical Content for more information.

days-saved.name: Days saved
days-saved.hint: This sets the number of days that saved game state data is retained, meaning this is how far back you can rewind time in your game before you run out of saved data.

rotation.name: Ship token rotation
rotation.hint: If straight up is 0 degrees, where does the bow of your ship token point? For example, ship tokens from the Pirate Borg Premium Module point down, so that’s 180.

captain.title: Captain
captain.desc: The captain must be a skilled and dependable seaman and a bold and decisive leader. He’s responsible for choosing prey, how to engage a target, how to pursue it, how to escape authorities, and how to deal with an attack. He’s elected by popular vote and can be replaced the same way. His authority is unquestionable only during action.
captain.sans: The captain is a necessary role on your ship. Without a captain, you’re not ready to set sail.

quartermaster.title: Quartermaster
quartermaster.desc: The quartermaster has equal authority to the captain except during action. He’s elected by the crew to represent their interests and check the captain’s power. He takes command when the captain is absent, administers the articles, keeps order, settles conflicts, maintains the ledgers, and dispenses food, water, and rum to each member of the crew.
quartermaster.sans: The quartermaster is a necessary role on your ship. Without a quartermaster, you’re not ready to set sail.

sailing-master.title: Sailing Master
sailing-master.desc: The sailing master oversees the navigation and sailing of the ship. He would have to be literate in order to read charts and was usually the most educated member of the crew.
sailing-master.sans: The sailing master is a necessary role on your ship. Without a sailing master, you’re not ready to set sail.

bosun.title: Bosun
bosun.desc: The bosun (or boatswain) supervises supplies and deck activities, including handling sails and weighing and dropping anchor. He inspects the ship every morning and reports its condition to the captain, but usually reports to the quartermaster. On ships that have a bosun, he takes responsibility for disciple, often making him the most feared member of the crew.
bosun.sans: The quartermaster can fulfill the bosun’s duties if there is no designated bosun.

gunner.title: Master Gunner
gunner.desc: The Master Gunner is responsible for all of the firearms aboard the ship, from personal arms and cannons. He picks and runs the gunnery crew and is the only member of the crew besides the captain and the quartermaster to carry a key to the ship’s powder magazine. He also picks and leads hunting parties, when called for. The master gunner reports to the quartermaster.
gunner.sans: A ship might be able to get by without a master gunner if the entire crew (and the bosun and/or quartermaster in particular) are conscientious about their firearms.

carpenter.title: Carpenter
carpenter.desc: The master carpenter is responsible for all of the woodworking aboard the ship, most importantly repairs to the hull, masts, and other wooden parts of the ship. He reports to the bosun (or quartermaster if the ship has no bosun).
carpenter.sans: A ship without a carpenter is at risk of taking on a great deal of bilge from untreated leaks and will have a more difficult time repairing damage taken.

cook.title: Cook
cook.desc: In addition to preparing meals, the cook is responsible for the food, water, and rum aboard the ship. He is the only member of the crew trusted to light a fire below decks. He reports to the bosun (or quartermaster if the ship has no bosun).
cook.sans: A ship without a cook will be faced with a potentially terrible fate: the bosun’s cooking.

surgeon.title: Surgeon
surgeon.desc: The surgeon serves as the ship’s barber, doctor, and medic, though it’s a blessed ship that has a surgeon with actual medical experience. He reports to the quartermaster.
surgeon.sans: A ship without a surgeon will have to make do with the cook or carpenter if a member of the crew is in need of medical attention.

master-arms.title: Master at Arms
master-arms.desc: The Master at Arms is responsible for training crew in hand-to-hand combat and leading boarding parties. He reports to the quartermaster.
master-arms.sans: Most ships do not have a dedicated master at arms, in which case these duties fall to the quartermaster.

priest.title: Deck Priest
priest.desc: The deck priest is a holy man who calls upon Providence (or some other Power) to aid the ship with fair winds or other divine help. He reports to the sailing master.
priest.sans: Most ships do not have a deck priest, and ships with a deck sorcerer almost never have a deck priest as well.

sorcerer.title: Deck Sorcerer
sorcerer.desc: The deck sorcerer is a practitioner of the arcane arts who uses sorcery to provide the ship with fair winds or other magical aid. He reports to the sailing master.
sorcerer.sans: Most ships do not have a deck sorcerer, and ships with a deck priest almost never have a deck sorcerer as well.
